bibl.title: Cover letter and transaction statement ending June 30, 1909, Lincoln Land Company

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, MS407 Bronson Rumsey Collection

div1.note:
Office of Lincoln Land Company,
Rooms 9 to 16. No. 140 South 13th St.
Lincoln, Neb.
C. H. Morrill, President.
A. B. Minor, Sec'y & Treasurer.
Executive Committee: H. B. Scott. Charles E. Perkins. C. H. Morrill, A. B. Minor.
Incorporated April 1880.
Quotations of Prices Are Subject to Change without Notice.
State Journal to Lincoln Neb.
div1.p: Herewith the usual semi-annual statement, covering the transactions had with respect to the property at Cody, held jointly by yourself, as trustee, and this company, for the period ending June 30 last, showing a balance of $362.61 due this company, since which time we have paid an additional water assessment of $320.00.

The item of $500.00, "County Division Matters", represents the amount of subscription to the fund to aid in procuring the division if Big Horn county and the locating of Cody as the county seat of the new Park county.
You will note that business up there has been mighty quiet. Quite a number of people up there were knocked pretty hard by the failure of the big irrigation company opening up Oregon Basin.
Statement of business transacted at Cody, Wyoming, by the Lincoln Land Company, with respect to the one-half interest of Bronson Rumsey, trustee, for the six months ending June 30, 1909.
div1.note: [View image of six-month financial statement ending June 30, 1909, for full display.]
div1.ab:
B. Rumsey Trustee
Lincoln Land Co. Report—
July. 1909
